title_sort: benton h. wilson to walt whitman, 15 may 1870
title: Benton H. Wilson to Walt Whitman, 15 May 1870
text: GreeneMay 15th/70Dear FriendWalt Whitman,Your letter we welcomed of april 15th was received some time ago but I very busy and haven't time to answer it before. It gives me great pleasure to receive a letter from you and be able to hear the .My Father died May 2nd and was buried on the 4th I was in Syracuse a few days before he died to see him for the Last time alive He waited anxiously for the and welcomed death as a friend to take him to a better countryhe Died as he has always lived a good man & a Christian.The Syracuse Journal says A Good Man Goneâ€”For years Henry Wilson has proved honesty and Efficiency as with itinerary ing and surprising Cloaks always earned an thought the he could give to God, his fellow men. The , especially wil his kindly words and services The meaning of the first is ."My Mother is well this summer Little Walt and the rest of my family are all well. he is quite a boy now and can run out doors and get into all kinds of mischief.It is a beautiful quiet day here today and I would like it very much if we could be together to day and take a pleasant stroll through the green Fields and Woods.Write as soon as convenientWith Love to youYoursB. H. Wilson Benton H. Wilson to Walt Whitman, 15 May 1870
